headline: Shish Tawook Grilled Chicken
description: Shish tawook are Middle Eastern chicken kabobs. Make them at home by marinating chicken in yogurt, lemon, and spices; skewer with veggies and grill.
name: Shish Tawook Grilled Chicken
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 2 inch pieces
1 large green bell pepper, cut into large chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Mix yogurt, lemon juice, oil, garlic, tomato paste, salt, oregano, pepper, allspice, cinnamon, and cardamom in a large bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat; transfer into a resealable plastic bag, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Thread chicken, onions, and bell pepper onto metal skewers.
Cook on preheated grill until chicken is golden and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes on each side. Sprinkle parsley over the skewers.

review.reviewBody: Incredibly delicious! I fell in love with Shish Tawook while in Qatar (Turkey Central). After a long search, I found this recipe. Similar to those who have commented before, I modify it slightly using a little Paprika, Turmeric, and Cayenne Pepper. It is my wife's favorite dish. We love to share the rich flavor with friends when they visit.

Very delicious. I did add some Garam Masala, Balti, and Tandoori seasonings along with a tablespoon of chili garlic paste to the marinade to give it a kick. Served with another cook's "Thick-Style Lebanese Garlic Sauce" from this site, and this meal was a winner! Great recipe!
Amazing! I can’t wait to make again.

This recipe is flavorful and aromatic. It is a great go to when you have company and you want to impress them but you do t want to spend all day in the kitchen. 5-10 minutes to prepare the marinade and a quick cook on the grill. The chicken is tender and moist. I added a side of grilled peaches. It was a lovely accompaniment.

I really like this recipe! I marinated the chicken for about 24 hours and I’m too lazy to put everything on kabobs, so I just poured the chicken and the marinade on a sheet pan and it turned out moist and flavorful.
Delicious. Served to company. Very impressive. Excellent taste. Will make it again.

I love this recipe! Spices and flavors were spot on. I noticed that several reviews said their results were bland, so I increased the amount of spices and salt by about 50% and added a couple of splashes of hot sauce to the marinade .
I added sliced of zucchini and cherry tomatoes to the kabob line up too.
I used 8.5 inch skewers and got 12 kabobs.
I grilled them on my Ninja Foodie Grill for 15 minutes on the highest grill heat setting (510 degrees F)

I typically do not post reviews of recipes, but I just had to for this one. This is, by far, one of the best recipes. This tastes exactly like what you’d order at a restaurant. If I could give this 10 stars, I would. Thank you for sharing!
The chicken was nice and juicy. Well seasoned! But I prefer my bell peppers and onions cooked a little bit more thoroughly. Also it's hard to cook all the pieces uniformly.
This is a great recipe. I added 1 tsp oregano along with the other spices because restaurants seem to flavor theirs with oregano.
Serve with sauce for other tawook recipe on this site.
So good! I went lighter on the cinnamon but otherwise followed this exactly. Kids loved it too.
Delicious recipe. Chicken was moist and very tender. Husband loved it too.
It was very tasty and tender. Next time I will put it directly on the grill instead of the foil. I put all the juice and felt it was too mushy.
Love this recipe - it always is so tasty !

This recipe is excellent as written. I have made it several times. It needed NO alterations. I paired it with a garlic sauce recipe on this site. DELISH!! As a side dish I use Mahotma yellow saffron rice and make a red sauce with fresh tomatoes, tomato sauce, onions, garlic, and basil for the rice.
The perfect kabob. A nice blend of flavours and great for the family.
My first 2 attempts weren't good until the third time when I increased some of the spices and especially salt, and it turned out extremely delicious. Thanks for sharing :)
Fantastic recipe. Totally legit
Family favorite!

Delicious in our book! The flavor is well balanced and chicken was very tender. I used Green Valley lactose free plain yogurt. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. Served with rice and a side salad. Easy and tasty dinner that we'll make again! Thanks for the recipe!

This is a rock star recipe! I wish Incould rate it higher than 5! I follow the recipe exactly- no swaps, no modifications; it doesn’t need any. (My bf does prefer it with a little less oil in the marinade.) I’ve made this SO many times that I have memorized the recipe. It is flavourful and delicious. We eat the Shish Tawook in tortillas with marinated turnips (the purple ones) and fresh tomatoes along with some homemade garlic yogurt sauce. Thank you so much for sharing your amazing recipe. 

FYI: I’ve also made this recipe and put it in the freezer in sealed bags for cooking at a later date. It works well and tastes great even after being frozen.
The marinade is perfect. It adds wonderful flavor without overpowering the chicken. It's delicious!
Delicious had I marinated overnight would have been better. Served with hummus homemade and soft taco wraps. Thanks for sharing!
This is so flavorful and tender! Grilled it and everyone ate it with diners ranging from 4 to 66.
My family absolutely loves it. Very easy and quick to make.
Restaurant worthy!
Even our very picky 8 yr old son loves it.
Meat came out very tender and moist and DELICIOUS. Good flavor from the spice but not overwhelming at all. Will definitely make again. Served it with tahini sauce and pita wrap bread.
Delicious, and just like the pre marinated chicken I buy from the middle eastern grocery store

I did add some more heat...cayenne, siracha... whatever you have and also a little more salt and turmeric. It just needed more per some reviews. I used sour cream because I was out of plain yogurt. It was very tender, even though I only marinated for one and half hours. Great basic recipe which is what I was looking for. This is a very popular dish in the Middle East. Different recipes had slightly different ingredients. Will definitely make again. My husband asked if I had kept this recipe because he would like it again. I did not thread on any veggies, but I know it would only add flavor. Thanks for this recipe
This was a fantastic recipe. I used olive oil instead, I added more garlic, oregano and salt, and 2 tsp of mild pepper paste. It was very tender and delicious! It was a hit at my dinner party.

made this last weekend. doubled the recipe but kept same ratios. No changes to recipe (except EVOO instead of vegetable oil) or process. Chicken marinated overnight and came out tender and delicious. So easy to make!

If I could give it more stars , I would !!! 
Anyone coming from a middle Eastern family knows how frustrating it can get to ask for recipes. They would mostly answer add a little bit of this and that. No measurements NOTHING !! 
You try it and it tastes like nothing you want to taste ever again!!!
I Literally stopped cooking Lebanese recipes ! 
Thank you so much NOOR! I can’t say thank you enough. 
This tastes just like home. It was amazing. We ate it with garlic mayo, fries and hummus .... it wasn’t Devine!
Didn’t change a thing !

The meat should marinate in the yogurt mix as long as you can afford (overnight is even better than the 4 hours suggested. Also, grilling these are FAR better than cooking them stovetop. If you can't grill it, at least use a grill pan in the oven. It makes a difference.

This is insanely good. One of my favorite chicken recipes and a winner with my picky kids. I leave out oregano because I loathe that spice, and I use a dash of nutmeg instead of cardamom. I serve with rice pilaf (also from allrecipes). Amazing.
Very tender. We didn't have cardamom and I forgot the parsley, but it was still great!
Everyone loved it. I made a few modifications - less salt and I freshly ground my spices and marinated it for 24 hours.

Absolutely delicious. Easy to follow, as close to the Mid-East restaurants of Detroit as it gets. I will make it again and again. I also used the Lebanese garlic sauce recipe on here as well. Paired nicely with grilled shrimp and rice. Thanks for the recipe!

Huge success. I had a couple of leftover kebabs which were great the next day. Love the ease of this dinner as I'm always looking for something that can be made ahead of time. With veggies, this is a well-balanced and healthy meal. I served it with the Lebanese Garlic Sauce which was a nice accompaniment.
A very nice change of pace from other marinades or Barbecue sauces. Easy to make too.
Yum Yum Yum. never written a review before but this was worth writing one for. Did not change a thing.
I had pre-mixed Tawook seasoning I purchased from a missionary. I substituted the dry seasonings and garlic in the recipe with 2 Tbsp of Tawook seasoning. I'm sure the flavor is the just as good.
My family liked this very much and will make it again. We marinated it overnight and it was moist and flavorful
This recipe was fantastic. Everyone in my family gave it a bid thumbs up. The yogurt marinade made the chicken very tender and flavorful. I served it with basmati rice and it was great!!

I followed the recipe but replaced vegetable oil with olive oil since that’s all I have. It turned out like what we get from restaurant. Moist and DELICIOUS. I love it!! My 2yo approves it and that good enough for me. Thank you for the recipe. Does anyone know if I can freeze the left over? It’s quite plenty for 2.5 people ??
Thought it was plenty spicy. My chicken was cut thin, could have been a little thicker
This was amazing!!! Followed the directions exactly. I wouldn't change a thing except to make more next time! We loved it!

I didn't have the cardamom, didn't add tomato paste or black pepper. I added just a pinch of cayenne pepper and tumeric. I used my NuWave to cook it. Yum! Although next time, I'm using Greek yogurt and also adding some dill.

I have made this dish so many times I can't give ya a number! I have passed this on to family and friends and they love it! One friend now has made this a part of her weekly dinner routine!! Great chicken!! Thanks for sharing!!!
Excellent dish, good for company and leftovers!

Do not listen to the person below that tells you to substitute cardamom for nutmeg and cinnamon. That’s a huge NO NO AND A NO! Cardamom is the main spice and it is NOT expensive and can be found in pretty much any spice isle at your grocery store, if you don’t use this spice You might as well not even bother making this I actually Omit the cinnamon in this recipe to get the traditional real deal Lebanese shish tawook. Been eating it since I was a kid. Trust me, I’m Lebanese
So yummy. I have made this several times and I loved it each
I made this EXACTLY as instructed. It was incredible! Thank you so much for this very awesome recipe!
I've made this a few times, and it's always delicious. Just be careful not to overcook the chicken!

This is one of my all-time favorite things to eat. I'm not a huge cook, but when I do want to cook or have friends over and cook for them, this is my go-to. I'm a big fan of Lebanese food as well as going out to dinner. This recipe is as good as anything you would get at a Lebanese restaurant. When I make this I serve it with pita bread, hummus, and Lebanese rice (a recipe from AllRecipes). Would also pair wonderfully with Fatoosh salad.
This is a fantastic recipe. Delicious, always impresses our guests

I've never had much luck with yogurt-based marinades. The flavors never seem to soak into the chicken. Next time, I'll try marinating it overnight.

This was good. I felt it could've used a tad bit more salt and some heat of some kind. When we make this again, I will probably: a) double all of the spices except salt, b) Add an extra 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and c) marinate it overnight.
Absolutely delicious! We love garlic so I added additional but no other changes. Made extra and once cooled removed from skewers and froze. Great reheated!!

This was awesome. I followed the recipe exactly, since I like to try it using the original recipe first, before tweaking it. I wouldn't change a thing. The spices were just right - don't skip the cardamom! It was super moist. I served it with Tabbouleh III from allrecipes.com, as someone else suggested, Greek yogurt dill dipping sauce, hummus from the store and pitas from the store. It made a wonderful dinner, and it was so easy to make.
Made exactly as written, only added an 8-oz. box of whole mushrooms to the vegetables. Turned out fantastic! I have a hunch this recipe will be made many times this summer.

I made this to marinade last night. My husband Kelly and I are camping over the summer and my intent was to follow the recipe to the tee but what I like about this recipe is that it is very forgiving. I did not have allspice so I looked up what to do. Take cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg. The recipe did not really say which garlic to use where so I put pre minced garlic in the marinade and the salt in the dip. At first it was a little salty then I added lemon juice. It was delicious. I also only used 1/2 a cup of mayonnaise with 2 tablespoons of Greek plain yogurt. Again all I had. I did not have peppers but did marinade the onions all night with the meat. I did not have cardamon so again I ad-libbed and looked it up in google. We used two tablespoons of ketchup because that is all we had. It was soooooo good. Both of us give it a 5. I will try next time to make it as states. Thank you so much!
I love this recipe, will never order out again
Delicious! I marinated it for 24 hours (just to save me time on the actual cooking day). We don't like bell peppers, so I substituted chunks of fresh pineapple....YUM!
Was really good enjoyed every little bit. Easy to make.
tasty recipe

Such underrated recipe! I have made it so many times already everyone loves this recipe. It does require a lot of species but the flavor is unique and shines through unlike any other chicken kabob I've had!

this came out pretty good despite not having any tomato paste and not really tasting much of the cardamom (it's probably past it's prime).. we still enjoyed this.. added a little more salt and didn't bother with the veggies or parsley.. ty for the recipe
Made with tabbouleh... delicious

I was a little scared with the combination of ingredients for the marinade but this turned out great and I followed the recipe exactly (although I forgot about the parsley at the end which I specifically bought for this!) Most authentic one I have tried. I used bottled lemon juice verses fresh b/c that is what I had and the individual serving size of plain greek yogurt which was just under the 3/4 cup. We prefer red pepper over green so I used that.

I was introduced to this recipe several years ago and since then, I make it monthly. I have several picky eaters in my family but this is everyone's "favorite chicken." I make this for guests of all ages, all the time and every single person (young children included), love it. Sometimes I put it in a pita with a side of couscous and other times I just have the shish kabobs without the pita sandwich. Either way, this will become a family favorite guaranteed.

A real hit with my family. I used and indoor grill pan and did not cube the chicken. I did cut the breasts in half as they were big. We don't like peppers so I left those out. When I make it again I'll make another batch of the marinade to use as a sauce for the meat and rice .I served with it.

We made this. Being remote Wyoming, we could not get yogurt so we made it with sour cream. It worked! It was outstanding. The toum I made wasn't so good but that is another story. The chicken came perfectly!
I will definitely make it again! Delicious! My husband did cook it longer than 5 minutes on each side, about 2 minutes longer on each side.

This is the recipe I was looking for. However, I tweaked it just a little. I use Fage Greek yogurt and I was tasting some of the sourness of it too much on the chicken, so I doubled the oregano, tomato paste, garlic, pepper, cinnamon, allspice, added a half teaspoon of paprika and also added a teaspoon of red chili pepper flakes for a little heat. (I know it's not authentic) Seriously, twice I've promised my roommates that Id same some kabobs for them but I just can't help myself. They're just too freakin good. Nice char on the outside and restaurant quality moistness on the inside. I grill them on the BBQ first with aluminum foil on top of the grate then after they're decently cooked I let them char up by putting them directly on the grill. Do it!

Love the marinade in this. The only changes I made were to use a middle eastern spice mix called "Zahtar" I used about 2 tsps. in place of the spices they stated. you can find this spice mix on Amazon. I also marinaded the onions and peppers also, I used lemon juice, olive oil and a little white wine vinegar. plus some Zahtar. This recipe is a keeper!!! I will be making this again and again!!! soooo good! My family loved it!!
Made this for a BBQ with our neighbors - made 4 pounds of chicken with red peppers and onions for 6 adults and it was the perfect amount. It came out juicy, tender, and flavorful!
Made it exactly as written. Delicious!
Went with a little curry and ginger but stick to the recipe!
Absolutely the best, we couldn't stop eating it!
I have made this marinade twice for grilling chicken kabobs. It is really good. Results are moist tasty chicken!!

I made this as written for my picky yet honest brother except for one thing: I forgot to add the parsley at the end. We both loved it. He even remarked as he left that evening that I had a "keeper" recipe.
very good juicy and tender chicken loved it
very good
I made this for a dinner party with 30 people & it was the favorite of the night. Absolutely delicious! This is a must try recipe.

Just finished scarfing this down and I must say, what everybody has been saying here is true. This was fabulous and tasted just like the chicken I've had at many Lebanese restaurants. I followed the recipe to a T and did not change anything. I marinated skinless boneless chicken breasts for 9 hours and didn't cut them up. I cooked the chicken in the NuWave Oven-4" grill, 8 minutes one side, 13 minutes other side, and 5 minutes on first side again. In the NuWave at the same time, I roasted chunks of rutabega, after dunking them in the marinade, for a total of 30-35 minutes. This vegetable is tough and needs about 30 minutes at least. Ate it with pita and garlic sauce I made in the Magic Bullet: 5 garlic cloves, 1/4 cup Lemon juice, 6-8 ounces of grapeseed or canola oil, say a half tsp salt or to taste, 2 egg whites. Good thing about the Magic Bullet is that you really can just dump it all in and it emulsifies. After mixing for 30 secs to a minute total, I just poured it all out and then put back half and wizzed it until suddenly it takes on a mayonnaise like consistency. Then I did the other half. Perfect. This was an extremely tasty and easy meal. This is a real keeper.
Was skeptical. But wanted to try something different. We put it over a bed of brown rice. It was delicious. Even my picky 12 year old ate it and asked for more!

This was a wonderful recipe! I followed the recipe exactly as written and the flavor was wonderful. The chicken was moist and the flavor balance was great, nothing was overpowering. I served it wish tzatziki sauce, grilled veggies and grilled naan. We grilled the chicken but instead of putting it directly on the grill we left it on aluminum foil..it worked great and the chicken still had some char on it, plus easy clean up. Also, it was even better the next day!
This marinade is awesome! I've marinated beef in this too. The longer you marinate the meat the more flavorful it is!
Boy was this ever good! This is a keeper! I made no changes. Served it with homemade pitas, tzaziki, chopped lettuce,pickles,tomatoes, and onions. Ate til it ouched!
We have many great Middle Eastern/Mediterranean cuisine options in the Dearborn/Detroit area and this recipe tastes exactly like the restaraunts here. Will definitely be using this again!!
Fantastic! Tender and juicy chicken, excellent flavors. Easy to make once you have the ingredients on hand. Making again tonight!!

Our local Afghan restaurant has this and I always wondered exactly how it was made. Thanks for this recipe! And thanks to reviewers, I could tailor the spices to taste. After seeing the most helpful reviews, I skipped oregano, added heaping recipe measurements of the other spices except the black pepper. Instead of oregano, I added 1/2 tsp dried mint, pinch of turmeric and shake of cayenne pepper. Marinaded 5 hours, then grilled as directed with red/green peppers and onion. Served with seasoned saffron rice and fresh naan. This will be a regular from now on.
not was I exspced,,tender chicken yes,,bland yes,,

Amazing dish. Packed full of flavor. Everyone raved about it. Will definitely be making this again! Followed the recipe exactly. Didn't change a thing. Marinated for 24 hours. Then plans changed so I put the chicken in the marinade in the freezer. Removed it 48 hours prior to cooking. Was just fantastic!

I really loved it! I ended the skewers with a baby Bella mushroom, and sauteed the leftover marinade, veggies and little chicken pieces. I baked it at 500 for 20 minutes then broiled the first side for 5 minutes and the other side for 2 minutes. Served it with boxed rice pilaf and green beans so at least some of the dinner would have a familiar flavor. Chicken haters said it was OK, everybody loved the marinade!"

Perfect. My husband has Middle Eastern roots so we're always looking for things to cook that pay homage to his family's roots. The garlicky yogurt based marinade is delicious. Cardamom was hard to find, and when I did finally track it down it was fairly pricey. I have made the recipe with and without it and I couldn't taste a difference at all, so skip it if you don't have it on hand. My kids declared this recipe their favorite of the summer so far, so it's going in our rotation for sure!
I followed the recipe as listed, except I didn't have cardamom. It still turned out terrific. It's a delicious marinade and combination of flavors. My boyfriend also enjoyed it. I'll make this again.

Thnx for a great recipe!! Absolutely delicious made extra sauce to add to the chicken we loved it just spicy enough for our taste!!!! Made it just as posted perfect!!! Little extra heat would be good next time!
